swerve.drive

Class FESwerveDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • RobotDriveBase
      • swerve.drive.SwerveDrive
        • swerve.drive.FESwerveDrive

  • public class FESwerveDrive
extends SwerveDrive
    Expands on the SwerveDrive for better autonomous control. Uses swerve wheels with drive encoders, in the form of FESwerveWheel.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class swerve.drive.SwerveDrive

        flWheel, frWheel, rlWheel, rrWheel

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a new FESwerveDrive given FESwerveWheel wheels.
      FESwerveDrive(FESwerveWheel _flWheel, FESwerveWheel _frWheel, FESwerveWheel _rlWheel, FESwerveWheel _rrWheel, double _widthToHeightRatio)
      Creates a new FESwerveDrive given FESwerveWheel wheels.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDescription() 
      double getDistanceTraveled()
      Gets the distance traveled, in inches, since the last distance reference was set.
      void setDistanceReference()
      Sets a distance reference on the encoders, such that the output of getDistanceTraveled() will be based on the distance from this reference.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FESwerveDrive

        public FESwerveDrive(FESwerveWheel _flWheel,
                     FESwerveWheel _frWheel,
                     FESwerveWheel _rlWheel,
                     FESwerveWheel _rrWheel)
        Creates a new FESwerveDrive given FESwerveWheel wheels. Note: FESwerveDrive(FESwerveWheel, FESwerveWheel, FESwerveWheel, FESwerveWheel, double) should be used instead if the wheelbase and track are not equal.
        Parameters:
        _flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        _frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        _rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        _rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel

      • FESwerveDrive

        public FESwerveDrive(FESwerveWheel _flWheel,
                     FESwerveWheel _frWheel,
                     FESwerveWheel _rlWheel,
                     FESwerveWheel _rrWheel,
                     double _widthToHeightRatio)
        Creates a new FESwerveDrive given FESwerveWheel wheels.
        Parameters:
        _flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        _frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        _rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        _rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel
        _widthToHeightRatio - The ratio from the track to the wheelbase (the distance between the centers of the front or back wheels divided by the distance between the centers of the left or right wheels). FESwerveDrive(FESwerveWheel, FESwerveWheel, FESwerveWheel, FESwerveWheel) is recommended if this ratio is 1:1.

    • Method Detail

      • setDistanceReference

        public void setDistanceReference()
        Sets a distance reference on the encoders, such that the output of getDistanceTraveled() will be based on the distance from this reference.
        Overrides:
        setDistanceReference in class SwerveDrive

      • getDistanceTraveled

        public double getDistanceTraveled()
        Gets the distance traveled, in inches, since the last distance reference was set. This value is determined by the average distance traveled for each FESwerveWheel, so the return value of this method is only going to be accurate if all FESwerveWheel wheels are steered in the same direction (or an equivalent angle).
        Overrides:
        getDistanceTraveled in class SwerveDrive
        Returns:
        The number of inches traveled
        See Also:
        setDistanceReference()

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Overrides:
        getDescription in class SwerveDrive
